title: Command Line Interface
description: Couper is build as binary called couper with the following commands:

children.value: Couper is build as binary called
Start the server with given configuration file.
options can also be configured with
Print the usage for the given command:
Verify the syntax of the given configuration file.
Print the current version and build information.
Path to a Couper configuration file.
Path to a directory containing Couper configuration files.
Name of environment in which Couper is currently running.
Watch for configuration file changes and reload on modifications.
Maximum retry count for configuration reloads which could not bind the configured port.
before next attempt if an error occurs.
output format. This is the default on containers.
Set the log-level to one of:
log format which pretty prints with basic key coloring.
Option for adding the given PEM encoded CA certificate to the existing system certificate pool for all outgoing connections.
Note: Couper can be started with multiple
are loaded in alphabetical order. Blocks and attributes defined in later files may override those defined earlier. See

props.code:
$ tree
.
├── conf
│ ├── a.hcl
│ ├── b.hcl
│ └── c.hcl
├── devel.hcl
└── global.hcl

1 directory, 5 files

$ couper run -f global.hcl -d conf/ -f devel.hcl -log-level=debug
DEBU[0000] loaded files … […/global.hcl …/conf/a.hcl …/conf/b.hcl …/conf/c.hcl …/devel.hcl] …
…
